did.unittitle: Mary Helen Wingate Lloyd theater scrapbooks

bioghist.p: Mary Helen Wingate Lloyd (1868-1934) was an expert gardener and director of the Garden Club of America from 1928-1933. She was an organizer and charter member of American Iris Society, and was also active in the Pennsylvania Horticultural Society. As a young woman, she was active in arts and horticultural organizations and was interested in the cause of woman's suffrage.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 20 scrapbooks of theatrical, musical, and sporting events. Each scrapbook contains theater programs, playbills, announcements and actor profiles. Theaters from New York and Philadelphia are well represented, but there are also materials for other American and some European cities. Other forms of entertainment are also well represented, including: football score cards and programs; church bulletins; and programs for recitals, concerts, readings and memorial services. In addition the volumes include several Bryn Mawr May Day programs and playbills.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
